C71D2EC1A98243C1B75A09F1F3D71DA9.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in custom woodworking (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, technical drawings, reports, photographs of completed projects, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan and Transition Plan), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement

50C5283C006B4902A551BCAD85AFA5CB.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the custom woodworking industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., teamwork, customer service, entrepreneurship);

101CF41C117C4160A6CE8B09B079D067.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the custom woodworking industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., reading text, document use, measurement and calculation);

EBA32DA96F7940BF9A0F677F0419E756.description: explain the importance of lifelong learning for someone choosing a career in the custom woodworking industry;

089847E3F6124BA29B1CBF3ED3BDE656.description: describe the education and training required for careers in custom woodworking (e.g., apprenticeship, postsecondary programs);

2503274340B543EDBFD1A23A84954337.description: describe careers in the custom woodworking industry (e.g., designer, trim carpenter, cabinetmaker, artisan, industrial woodworker, technician, technologist);

731C9807E443471785CBE9F50216BAE0.description: Career Opportunities: demonstrate an understanding of careers in the custom woodworking industry, and the skills, education, and training required for these careers.

6DBA3BE6FFDD4D1C9A25F6EA33D50FF9.description: identify various types of business structures (e.g., sole proprietorship, partnership, limited company).

9057932AD3194A9DB685EEEDEDBA1EC0.description: identify and compare the organization and management of unionized and non-unionized custom woodworking companies (e.g., role of lead hand, shop steward, and contractor);

ABB44A15E31A4915AF891CF4E27033ED.description: describe the factors that should be considered when starting and/or operating a custom woodworking business (e.g., potential market, products, competition, financing, business plan)

F40437B5717045CCBCCC370C9CE7A2B8.description: describe the skills important for success as an entrepreneur in the custom woodworking industry (e.g., communication, organization, creativity, problem solving);

2AD025C9D5D54712A86F1C100FB23B08.description: Custom Woodworking Business: describe the knowledge and skills important for success in a custom woodworking business;

06BD6F5532B846BC905313D3F3F71263.description: demonstrate an understanding of how to select and use appropriate protective clothing, gear, and equipment (e.g., dust mask, respirator, safety glasses, goggles, ventilation system).

B3B1E55824D54539B96C482D82D2E9A9.description: demonstrate safe practices when using woodworking materials, processes, tools, equipment, and facilities;

9449D878AD684EAC8079F8FCF57615D0.description: understand the rights and responsibilities of employees (e.g., the right to know, the right to refuse, the right to participate, as outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act);

CEBD004A756647DA9E82EE8367B4435C.description: describe an understanding of health and safety legislation, regulations, and standards that apply to the custom woodworking industry (e.g., Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS], Workplace Safety and Insurance Board [WSIB] regulations, provincial labour legislation, Ontario Building Code, local by-laws);

1C088F803ADA4F08A83A89C1715574E2.description: describe hazards related to woodworking materials, processes, tools, and equipment (e.g., flammable or toxic fumes from solvents, paints, and varnishes; risk of injury from tools and equipment);

D2B01F81A7F146CE9DC8C3D2D2847C00.description: Health and Safety: explain and follow health and safety regulations and practices specific to woodworking;

EDEEAE1DEA62461F8E5BBCAC8F98B3DA.description: assess economic and societal issues related to the custom woodworking industry (e.g., waste disposal, labour supply, logging near Aboriginal communities, imports and exports, use of renewable and non-renewable resources).

700B8A0807EC4C829E3AC0482BF8E2B6.description: assess how consumer trends and technological innovations have affected employment in the custom woodworking industry (e.g., use of exotic or old-growth woods, sale of prefabricated furniture and cabinets in large retail outlets, use of computer assisted design [CAD] and CNC machines);

0C2F780732FA4669B1A9460209DC85F1.description: Technology and Society: demonstrate an understanding of how the woodworking industry and society affect each other.

BA81F7E3D8A74B23B246E5A60FA8874D.description: assess various certifications and/or standards used to recognize sustainable practices (e.g., Forest Stewardship Council Canada standards).

3A5BCF1289E843FDA47F6D35E1962798.description: plan projects and apply strategies to minimize or mitigate degradation of the environment (e.g., use efficient cutting patterns, reuse and recycle leftover materials, select sustainably produced products, contribute to restoration plans, purchase carbon offsets);

DBEA00DB6B5F41C69127D8E5835F79E7.description: assess the environmental effects of using scarce and/or exotic woods (e.g., destruction of rainforest and old-growth boreal forests, displacement of Aboriginal peoples, loss of wildlife habitat) and the extent to which sustainable forestry practices can reduce environmental degradation;

7ABCF939FD5A403BAD9C9C97C48E1FBB.description: describe ways to improve air quality in a living or working space through the choice of materials for woodworking projects (e.g., lumber, plastics, medium-density fibreboard, paint, varnish);

15FB563D988741649F552188711EAE5E.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of the environmental effects of the woodworking industry, and ways of reducing harmful effects;

9E2FD1A67E494EE6846F93C5D594B2AB.description: select and correctly install appropriate surface materials (e.g., laminates, ceramics, butcher block, wood veneer) on a variety of counters and/or furniture.

A6C0DF8DAB104BECB23951DB9BA5FEC6.description: select suitable finishes (e.g., stain, paint, varnish, oil, wax), taking into account the type of material to be finished, the function of the finish, and the intended use of the project, and use appropriate methods to apply these finishes correctly (e.g., brush, spray, roller);

0856868682CA4A0488DAE5A866A0A757.description: use appropriate tools, equipment, and techniques correctly and safely to install trim and hardware (e.g., baseboards, hinges, pulls, casters);

AFEA68E7AB084CAAA9DF6C180100657C.description: demonstrate a thorough understanding of how to prepare surfaces for finishes given the type of material, the desired finish, and the intended use of the project;

1C04D8E42EED4905A17AC83AE2028B66.description: Finishing: prepare surfaces and apply finishing products, trim, and hardware correctly and safely.

CBECC77B770944459AADDF10A563AEEE.description: install various components of a woodworking project in accordance with applicable codes, regulations, and standards.

475A5D8A51824771BF13AE1E7C46B279.description: develop and apply appropriate quality-control measures to ensure precise dimensions and correct assembly (e.g., accurate measurements and cuts, clean joints, true edges)

1ECA1A87F3624382A79CA0C5531779FF.description: program a computer numerically controlled (CNC) machine to fabricate components for a woodworking project;

799A8DD6CB744305B75175B2A6ED51C1.description: use tools, equipment, and techniques to safely and accurately prepare project materials (e.g., dress raw lumber; measure, cut, square, and drill stock);

71A32803C41E4D329A4BDD3EA2601ABE.description: apply techniques for using tools and materials safely and efficiently to reduce the cost of producing components that meet the required specifications (e.g., follow proper procedures for operating machine tools; use stops, guides, or jigs when making sets of identical parts);

9B8522651B3F4EACBE5A40653ADCE469.description: Fabrication and Assembly: fabricate and assemble residential and/or commercial custom woodworking projects safely, accurately, and efficiently;

955B9703C6C04584A6210B71AD1D867E.description: prepare detailed, accurate estimates of quantities and costs of materials for woodworking projects (e.g., lumber, hardware, finishes), and of labour costs for these projects

A38CEEC0C1E746B79C9FD266D28E467D.description: determine lengths, diameters, and quantities of fastening devices needed to assemble various woodworking projects (e.g., lengths and gauges of screws, nails, and staples; diameters of dowels);

812782E63F014C2B95B0F8157D457BD7.description: apply mathematical concepts and formulas (e.g., Pythagorean theorem, volume and area formulas) when preparing components of a woodworking project;

A65ADBF6E58242C58B32B21467BCE86D.description: convert between fractions and decimals and between imperial and metric units, using appropriate charts, tables, software, and/or online conversion tools, to determine dimensions and quantities for woodworking projects (e.g., convert lengths from inches to centimetres, areas from square metres to square feet, and volumes from gallons to litres);

8BF889AD32F24F13A9AE8935FFC0D201.description: calculate dimensions for woodworking projects in appropriate metric and/or imperial units

FE5A039352264C7F97A77F5B935005AB.description: Mathematical Skills: apply the mathematical skills required in the design and construction of woodworking projects.

13EF3390304943EDB58EC13A3FA229B9.description: describe and, where appropriate, make modifications to woodworking projects to improve the quality and value of the project (e.g., choose different materials, hardware, finishes, or methods of construction and assembly).

22163A3AA79E426CB12866296F1A613F.description: lay out projects using a variety of measurement tools and equipment (e.g., laser level, tape measure, ruler, scale, protractor);

533DCE0BF3EA48428F9CDFE10A69AD09.description: plan an efficient sequence for fabricating components for a project (e.g., use appropriate tools and techniques, do operations such as cutting and drilling in batches to reduce set-up time);

3A16AC162F114802B4E0624B86C07E76.description: plan and prepare for installation of various components used in woodworking projects (e.g., make a work schedule and list of tools required, check stock on hand, order materials);

29D9073646884B749AA992D19F6C61A9.description: create a materials list itemizing all materials and components for a woodworking project;

9B5FD5C88CB2417682DB879F7CFCDDBF.description: plan and describe the interrelationship of structural and decorative elements in woodworking projects (e.g., choose structural and finish materials that will bond to each other; choose hardware that suits the shape and style of the design);

E3F4BB2D221244418463367362736760.description: Planning and Preparation: plan efficient and effective fabrication and assembly of residential and/or commercial woodworking projects;

ACAEA637764E43C685D2BCD853F0E3BC.description: interpret a variety of working drawings accurately to produce woodworking projects (e.g., determine dimensions, materials, and hardware placement).

21207AC34F5A4B77AF5B32B458A81B87.description: prepare and/or modify sketches and working drawings (e.g., orthographic view, plan, elevation, section, detail drawing), using manual and/or computer-assisted methods and appropriate metric and/or imperial units;

43387EFD20544596811A2B9C11369153.description: Working Drawings: prepare and interpret sketches and/or working drawings for a variety of woodworking projects;

99526A81C79B4FF08AD3451651B85790.description: describe product standards that apply to woodworking projects (e.g., Canadian Standards Association [CSA], Underwriters Laboratories of Canada [ULC], and National Lumber Grades Authority standards).

77A58E7EF4EA4EF18749EEA4894A1F69.description: describe the building codes and regulations that apply to built-in woodworking projects (e.g., Ontario Building Code [Part 7 – Plumbing and Part 9 – Housing and Small Buildings], fire codes, municipal by-laws);

341FD652C2BA47D18612181FE00A80CB.description: apply anthropometric measurements and ergonomic principles to projects (e.g., for the height and width of a chair seat or a desk);

C5BE4EA3CABF46A1B63F0046705DD973.description: explain the reasons for choosing particular materials for various woodworking projects (e.g., strength, cost, appearance, ease of use, availability, environmental considerations)

C1F2931947E345959B74A0AD7B167C51.description: describe how to enhance the appearance and functionality of woodworking projects by using appropriate design elements (e.g., line, space, texture, colour) and principles (e.g., balance, scale, proportion, emphasis, unity, continuity);

4A6E22E6FA8B4AB2864184497C5D2369.description: demonstrate how the overall design of a project is affected by design concepts and other factors (e.g., structure, ergonomics, aesthetics, cost and availability of materials, customer needs);

BC8781FED01946C3966765726C870D10.description: use appropriate problem-solving processes and techniques to address challenges that arise in the course of various woodworking projects;

ABD68B5BEA034FBCBF08DDF9FBE06880.description: explain the steps of a design process, and apply them to plan and develop a variety of woodworking projects (e.g., kitchen counter, cabinet, entertainment centre, coffee table, desk)

148E970F04C04F4380B645963C5C968C.description: Design: apply a design process and other problem-solving processes and techniques when planning a variety of woodworking projects, taking into account design principles, safety standards, and other relevant factors;

579683C779E744CBB5C60DE2E478BBD6.description: use correct terminology to describe the distinguishing features of various cabinet and furniture styles (e.g., gothic, baroque, early colonial)

3C7246ED5F8C4FF29DCF75B653FB03B0.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe concepts related to custom woodworking projects (e.g., aesthetics, ergonomics, environmental stewardship, sustainability);

BE30454CF4B34F94A187C62524F2AB6C.description: use correct terminology to identify and describe woodworking materials, tools, equipment, and processes (e.g., materials: adhesives, wood types, fasteners; tools: router, mitre saw, biscuit jointer, T-bevel, brad nailer; equipment: dustcollection system, spray painting booth, air compressor; processes: levelling, squaring, making plumb, joining

A35C5B21FACB4AEAB90A1433D084969A.description: Terminology: use correct terminology to describe woodworking materials, tools, equipment, processes, and related concepts.

B3E6887ADC5C459098AED97EF4063939.description: demonstrate proficiency in safely and accurately constructing and fitting commonly used joints (e.g., butt, half lap, mortise and tenon, dovetail, dowel, mitre, rabbet, tongue and groove).

DEF9F36E2C4B488FBC994952EE8EF4E8.description: demonstrate proficiency in the selection and safe application of appropriate clamps, fasteners, and adhesives;

5704A32C7697435A82C49099D412FA86.description: demonstrate proficiency with commonly used measuring, layout, and assembly methods (e.g., layout and measuring: determining and marking circumference, diameter, radius, angles, and rounded corners; assembly: fasteners, glues, milled joints);

0715481879C34533A5C5B2C7E6807396.description: demonstrate proficiency in using, maintaining, adjusting, and storing construction tools and equipment safely (e.g., chisels, planes, measuring instruments, table saws, drills, lathes);

C34B73C41C334DEBB7AF240D8095D0CD.description: Tools, Equipment, and Techniques: demonstrate an understanding and safe use of tools, equipment, and techniques for custom woodworking;

4F7BD75A68D742C590AF8D72272C3724.description: describe procedures for mass-producing a product (e.g., use of patterns, jigs, automated machinery, and/or modular construction), and describe the advantages and disadvantages of mass production as opposed to custom woodworking (e.g., quality, cost per unit).

7748729C84EF41A3BD9FBCDF69EF24ED.description: demonstrate a thorough understanding of various materials and processes used to finish woodworking projects (e.g., materials: sandpaper, stains, oils, varnishes; processes: sanding, detailing, brushing, spraying);

9C1DABEDA4EF43278FE6E3B153409491.description: identify and describe various processes for fabricating components of a woodworking project (e.g., jointing, laminating, turning, milling);

76312E1F5BEC4DBD9504386DA47181D8.description: demonstrate an understanding of structural and non-structural components of woodworking projects (e.g., structural: rails, stiles, corner braces; non-structural: trim, finishes, hardware, lazy Susan);

751565583D4347519CDDD135C5FBA0BB.description: compare the properties (e.g., strength, stability, appearance) of natural and manufactured materials that are used for the same function (e.g., natural wood versus plywood or particleboard, linseed oil versus polyurethane);

4F496AEB185C4B6885988CFA1E519DD9.description: describe the advantages and drawbacks of manufactured materials used in custom woodworking (e.g., plywood, particle board, orientedstrand board, plastics, steel, adhesives);

637365F14D2141BC8C0BF2EDF510ED23.description: describe various moulding profiles and their applications (e.g., baseboard, casing, crown moulding);

B5D987EE9372455BB052F43B7D05A170.description: describe the factors that should be considered when selecting and purchasing wood products (e.g., cost, type of project, quality, flaws);

27D24B78E61E45AEA298F0094EC21AF8.description: describe the factors that affect the quality and classification of wood (e.g., harvesting method, cutting, drying, flaws);

05B34A9D0B0045D5A3ED75B3610BA942.description: Materials and Processes: describe the features and applications of materials and processes used in custom woodworking;
